issue.title: Collision system seems not work when there are joints in the model [Gazebo 1.5]

content.raw:
In [ODEPhysics::CollisionCallback lines 743-745](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/dae44f8efd4eddfe5d0e47f614d9b1fb0abfd3bb/gazebo/physics/ode/ODEPhysics.cc?at=default#cl-743), there is a check if two objects are connected by a joint they will not have contacts between them. So, if you created an intermediate link in between the two boxes, then they should collide with each other.

EDIT: The link I gave is for the default branch. Here's a link to the same code in the [gazebo_1.5 branch](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/1af6c7ffe77aef4846fa29bb73a5d04bcb7469ab/gazebo/physics/ode/ODEPhysics.cc?at=gazebo_1.5#cl-729).
content.html:
In ODEPhysics::CollisionCallback lines 743-745, there is a check if two objects are connected by a joint they will not have contacts between them. So, if you created an intermediate link in between the two boxes, then they should collide with each other.

EDIT: The link I gave is for the default branch. Here's a link to the same code in the gazebo_1.5 branch.
